UPCOMING PROGRAMS       About the Collection 
The Cahoon Museum’s art collection dates from the 18th century to the present and includes paintings, three-dimensional art, works on paper, and furniture. The collection furthers the museum’s mission of celebrating American art.
Collection highlights include early American paintings, artwork by 20th-century
hours_text:
Visit[Cahoon Museum](https://cahoonmuseum.org/author/cahoonadmin/ "Posts by Cahoon Museum")2025-12-22T07:43:31-05:00

### **CLOSED FOR THE SEASON**  
**Reopening March 18- December 20, 2026**

### Get tickets for the day of your visit!

[General Admission](http://71251.blackbaudhosting.com/71251/tickets?tab=3&txobjid=8db1d7b4-76b7-490e-bb01-91360870d8ab)

General admission is transferable for another day by contacting Visitor Services: Wednesdays – Sundays, 10am – 4pm, general admission is non-refundable.

To contact Visitor Services email: [info@cahoonmuseum.org.](mailto:info@cahoonmuseum.org)

### Activities for the whole family included with general admission

Learning Center (Second floor)  
Mermaid and Sea Creature Scavenger Hunt (Throughout museum)  
Sailors Valentines Gallery Activities ( Hearth Room)  
Main Gallery Activities (Trustees Gallery)  
Find the Birds: Alfie Glover Seek and Find (Gardens)  
Art Lab one Saturday per month (Lower level)  
Art Cart (Main floor)

## Museum Admission

Museum Members: No charge  
Adults: $10.00  
Seniors: $8.00  
Students: $8.00  
Child (under 12): No charge  
Card to Culture/SUN Bucks: $2.00 per person  
NARM Members: Free with NARM identified membership card – CARD MUST HAVE THE NARM SYMBOL  
NEMA (New England Museum Association): Free with NEMA Card  
Blue Star Families: Free (begins on Armed Forces Day and ends on Labor Day)

We work with Community partners to offer specific discounts to visitors.

#### March 18 @ 10:00 am \- 4:00 pm

[](https://cahoonmuseum.org/event/guided-tour-of-the-cahoon-museum-20/)

## [Guided Tour of the Cahoon Museum](https://cahoonmuseum.org/event/guided-tour-of-the-cahoon-museum-20/)

#### April 2 @ 11:00 am \- 12:00 pm

**About the Collection**

The Cahoon Museum’s art collection dates from the 18th century to the present and includes paintings, three-dimensional art, works on paper, and furniture. The collection furthers the museum’s mission of celebrating American art.

Collection highlights include early American paintings, artwork by 20th-century artists from the Cape Ann and Provincetown art colonies, folk art and painted furniture of Ralph and Martha Cahoon, and contemporary works by New En...
